text.0: forth from the bosom of the mountains eager as two swift mares with loosened rein contending.
text.1: like two bright mother cows who lick their youngling vipāś and sutudri speed down their waters.
text.2: impelled by indra whom ye pray to urge you ye move as twere on chariots to the ocean.
text.3: flowing together swelling with your billows o lucid streams each of you seeks the other.
text.4: i have attained the most maternal river we have approached vipāś the broad the blessed.
text.5: licking as twere their calf the pair of mothers flow onward to their common home together.
text.6: we two who rise and swell with billowy waters move forward to the home which gods have made us.
text.7: our flood may not be stayed when urged to motion what would the singer calling to the rivers.
text.8: linger a little at my friendly bidding rest holy ones a moment in your journey.
text.9: with hymn sublime soliciting your favour kuśikas son hath called unto the river.
text.10: indra who wields the thunder dug our channels he smote down vṛtra him who stayed our currents.
text.11: savitar god the lovelyhanded led us and at his sending forth we flow expanded.
text.12: that hero deed of indra must be lauded for ever that he rent ahi in pieces.
text.13: he smote away the obstructors with his thunder and eager for their course forth flowed the waters.
text.14: never forget this word of thine o singer which future generations shall reecho.
text.15: in hymns o bard show us thy loving kindness humble us not mid men to thee be honour.
text.16: list quickly sisters to the bard who cometh to you from far away with car and wagon.
text.17: bow lowly down be easy to be traversed stay rivers with your floods below our axles.
text.18: yea we will listen to thy words o singer with wain and car from far away thou comest.
text.19: low like a nursing mother will i bend me and yield me as a maiden to her lover.
text.20: soon as the bharatas have fared across thee the warrior band urged on and sped by indra.
text.21: then let your streams flow on in rapid motion i crave your favour who deserve our worship.
text.22: the warrior host the bharatas fared over the singer won the favour of the rivers.
text.23: swell with your billows hasting pouring riches fill full your channels and roll swiftly onward.
text.24: so let your wave bear up the pins and ye o waters spare the thongs.
text.25: and never may the pair of bulls harmless and sinless waste away.
